metadata.title: CVE-2023-3090 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the Linux Kernel ipvlan networkdriver can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Theout-of-bounds write is caused by missing skb->cb initialization in theipvlan network driver. The vulnerability is reachable if CONFIG_IPVLAN isenabled. We recommend upgrading past commit90cbed5247439a966b645b34eb0a2e037836ea8e.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
